de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.tripmodel.pathalgorithms

Class PedestrianStochPathSelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.uni_stuttgart.informatik.canu.tripmodel.pathalgorithms.PedestrianStochPathSelection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PathSearchingAlgorithm
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpeedPathSelection, VehicularStochPathSelection

    public class PedestrianStochPathSelection
extends java.lang.Object
implements PathSearchingAlgorithm
    This class implements the Path Selection Algorithm on Uncongested Street Network. The implementation is based on N. Oppenheim, "Urban Travel Demand Modeling: From Individual Choices to General Equilibrium", ISBN: 0-471-55723-4, Wiley-Interscience, January 1995.

    Author:
    Illya Stepanov

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean calculateWeights
      Indicates that edge weights must be calculated based on estimated travel times

      protected java.util.Map shortestPathDistances
      Shortest path distances to vertices from the given origin vertex Key: origin vertex, Value: array of distances
      protected float theta
      Path selection parameter
